name: BBQ Chicken Cornbread Pie
description: The best kind of pie is when BBQ chicken goodness is sitting on a bed of fluffy, crumbly cornbread!
recipeIngredient: 2  boneless (skinless chicken breasts, cooked and shredded)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly oil a 9-inch pie pan or coat with nonstick spray; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly oil a 9-inch pie pan or coat with nonstick spray; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking soda and salt.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking soda and salt.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large glass measuring cup or another bowl, whisk together buttermilk, butter and eggs.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large glass measuring cup or another bowl, whisk together buttermilk, butter and eggs.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour mixture over dry ingredients and stir using a rubber spatula just until moist. Add batter to the pie pan, smoothing out the top.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour mixture over dry ingredients and stir using a rubber spatula just until moist. Add batter to the pie pan, smoothing out the top.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken, onion and bell pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions become translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Add chili powder, cumin and hot sauce; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Stir in the tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce and brown sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken, onion and bell pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions become translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Add chili powder, cumin and hot sauce; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Stir in the tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce and brown sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce heat to low; simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened, about 5-7 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Reduce heat to low; simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened, about 5-7 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the cornbread. Sprinkle with cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the cornbread. Sprinkle with cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into oven and broil just until the cheese has melted, about 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into oven and broil just until the cheese has melted, about 3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice into wedges and serve immediately, garnished with parsley.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice into wedges and serve immediately, garnished with parsley.

review.reviewBody: So good!! Made today for lunch. Will definitely be enjoying the leftovers this week!
